intro: Ludwigia sphaerocarpa var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are often oval-shaped and can vary in color depending on light exposure. It is popular in aquariums due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
